home.welcomeText: Hi, I'm James Puzon, an undergraduate mechanical engineering student at the University of Pittsburgh. This site showcases my journey, skills, and experiences across education, professional work, and community engagement.
home.exploreDescription: Navigate through the different sections to learn more about my background, work, and how to get in touch:

sections.title: About James
sections.content: James grew up in Richmond, Virginia, but he now lives in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania where he attends the University of Pittsburgh as an undergraduate mechanical engineering student. He is a very active, and competitive person, always engaged in multiple sports. He is outgoing and involved in his community, holding a few leadership positions, and he always seems to be teaching himself something new: from web development to proper table tennis technique.

sections.title: Education
details: University of Pittsburgh, Swanson School of Engineering
B. S. Mechanical Engineering, Minors in Computer Science and Hispanic Language and Culture
Relevant coursework: Robotics, Mechatronics, Mechanical Design
Honors: Cathedral Presige Scholarship (full tuition), Frank V. Naugle Engineering Scholarship, Dean's List

subsections.title: Study Abroad
subsections.content: In Spain, James took classes to complete his Hispanic Languages and Culture Minor
details: Universidad de Alcalá, Alcalá de Henares, Spain

subsections.title: Prosthetic Innovations
details: Observed the design and fitting process of advanced prosthetic devices
Gained exposure to the application of microcontrollers to control movement at joints
Learned about interdisciplinary collaboration between engineers and healthcare professionals

subsections.title: Volume Crew
details: Collaborated with a construction team to install and secure volumes on metal cages for a national climbing competition
Set boulder problems for Olympic-level athletes with world-class climbing setters

subsections.title: Site Director
details: Passages Adventure Camp, Richmond, VA, Summer 2019-2024
Entrusted with the safety of campers participating in kayaking and rock climbing
Instructed campers on essential skills to achieve success in progressive skill levels
Supervised counselors in training, junior counselors, and full counselors to facilitate collaboration

subsections.title: President, Ping Pong Club at Pitt
subsections.content: James started playing ping pong competively as a freshman at Pitt when he joined the club’s competitive team. He was elected as President of the club as a Junior, and his duties include organizing four weekly meetings and managing the competitive team. As a part of the competitive team, James has competed in several NCTTA (National Collegiate Table Tennis Association) tournamnents.

subsections.title: Vice President, Outdoors Club at Pitt, Whitewater Section
subsections.content: James organizes kayaking and rafting trips for the Outdoors Club at Pitt. He manages safety and logistics to ensure that trips run smoothly.

projects.title: Senior Capstone Project
projects.description:
Fall 2025. Robot-assisted construction of fibrous materials. Academic sponsor: UPMC Laboratory of Ocular Biomechanics.
Description: Designed an end-effector for the Standard Bots RO1 to lay down and weave fibers.

projects.title: Multi-Robot Delivery System
projects.description: Fall 2025. Developed a ROS2 system to coordinate payload handoff between a PincherX-100 and Turtlebot3.

projects.title: PC Build
projects.description: Custom built gaming/workstation PC. Full build process documented in 4K, showcasing hands-on hardware knowledge, component selection, cable management, and system optimization.

projects.title: Rover Project
projects.description: Fall 2023. This project was for the Intro to Mechanical Design class at the University of Pittsburgh. The goal was to design a rover for speed and agility, given only a motor and solar panel.

contact.title: Get In Touch
contact.description: I'd love to hear from you! Whether you have a question, want to collaborate on a project, or just want to say hello, feel free to reach out.
contact.additionalInfo: Feel free to send me an email. I typically respond within 24-48 hours.
